alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 5:53PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST/9 PM EST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following areas, in southeast Alabama, Henry. In southwest Georgia, Clay, Quitman and Randolph. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CST /900 PM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 453 PM CST /553 PM EST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abbeville, Georgetown, Ricks Place, Bonapartes Retreat, Wire Bridge, Hatcher, Moores Crossroads, Garnersville, Coates, Crossroads, Thomas Mill Creek, Double Bridges, Morris, Scottsboro Crossroads, Screamer and Lawrenceville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
